libkovan
Class Motor

java.lang.Object
  libkovan.Motor

public class Motor
extends java.lang.Object

This class is provides a motor instance with all functions to control the motor. There is one additional method to turn off all motor.

Author:
Markus Klein

Constructor Summary
Motor(int motorPort)
          Generates a new motor instance on the specified motor port.

          Turns all motors off.

This methods waits until the motor completes any executes or position control moves.

moveAtVelecity

public void moveAtVelecity(int vel)
Moves the motor at velocity with the specified ticks per seconds.

Parameters:
vel - velocity in ticks per second (range from -1000 to 1000)

moveRelativePosition

public void moveRelativePosition(int speed,
                                 int pos)
Moves the motor from its current position to current position + pos.

Parameters:
speed - speed in ticks (range from -1000 to 1000)
pos - difference of the current and the final position

moveToPosition

public void moveToPosition(int speed,
                           int pos)
Moves the motor to the specified position at the specified. If motorPosition > specifiedPosition, the motor does not move.

Parameters:
speed - motor speed (range from 0 to 1000)
pos - motor position until the motor stops

setPidGains

public void setPidGains(int p,
                        int i,
                        int d,
                        int pd,
                        int id,
                        int dd)
Adjusts the weights of the PID control. If the motor is jerky, the p and d values should be reduced. If a motor lags far behind they should be increased.

Parameters:
p - numerator for p coefficient
i - numerator for i coefficient
d - numerator for d coefficient
pd - p respective denominator
id - i respective denominator
dd - d respective denominator

setPwm

public int setPwm(int dc)
Runs the motor at duty cycle dutycycle.

Parameters:
dc - speed from -100 to 100
Returns:

setPort

public void setPort(int port)
Sets the port of the motor.

Parameters:
port - port number

getPort

public int getPort()
Returns the port of this motor instance.

Returns:
motor port

drive

public void drive(int vel)
Turns on motor m at scaled PWM duty cycle percentage. This method is the equivalent to the libkovan function "motor".

Parameters:
vel - velocity from 100(full forward) to -100(full backward)

allOff

public static void allOff()
Turns all motors off.
